intro: Mallotus hirsutulus, commonly known as the hairy mallot, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its hairy, woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that contain several seeds. Mallotus hirsutulus is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, shaded environments.
